name: FindWorkspaceObjects
description:
Find objects in your workspace using filter conditions.

This tool is used to find and return a list of object IDs based on specified filter conditions in your Customerio workspace. It allows paging through results and setting limits on the number of objects returned. Useful for locating, creating, or modifying objects based on specific criteria.

parameters.name: page_start_token
parameters.description: Token for the page of results to return. Use the `next` property from a prior response to continue paging.

value_schema.description: The token for the page of results you want to return. Responses contain a `next` property. Use this property as the `start` value to return the next page of results.

parameters.name: maximum_results_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve per page.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results you want to retrieve per page.

parameters.name: filter_request
parameters.description: JSON containing 'object_type_id' and 'filter' to specify object search and filter conditions. Both are required. Ensure 'object_attribute' type_id matches 'object_type_id'.

object_type_id.description: The type of object you want to search in. Object type IDs are integers passed as strings.

filter.description:
When filtering for objects, you can use `and` and `or` arrays to determine the logic for a group of filter conditions. `not` reverses the filter condition and matches when the condition is false. `object_attribute` represents the individual conditions you can filter objects by.

The top level of this object can only contain a single property, but you can nest `and` and `or` properties to produce complex filters.

value_schema.description: The `object_type_id` you want to search in, and the `filter` you want to apply to find objects. Both are required. The object called `object_attribute` requires `type_id`, as well, which should match the `object_type_id`.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Customer.io App API

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The token for the page of results you want to return. Responses contain a `next` property. Use this property as the `start` value to return the next page of results.

value_schema.description: The token for the page of results you want to return. Responses contain a `next` property. Use this property as the `start` value to return the next page of results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results you want to retrieve per page.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results you want to retrieve per page.

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description: The `object_type_id` you want to search in, and the `filter` you want to apply to find objects. Both are required. The object called `object_attribute` requires `type_id`, as well, which should match the `object_type_id`.

object_type_id.description: The type of object you want to search in. Object type IDs are integers passed as strings.

filter.description:
When filtering for objects, you can use `and` and `or` arrays to determine the logic for a group of filter conditions. `not` reverses the filter condition and matches when the condition is false. `object_attribute` represents the individual conditions you can filter objects by.

The top level of this object can only contain a single property, but you can nest `and` and `or` properties to produce complex filters.

value_schema.description: The `object_type_id` you want to search in, and the `filter` you want to apply to find objects. Both are required. The object called `object_attribute` requires `type_id`, as well, which should match the `object_type_id`.
